file_insights.changes_summary: Added localization support to authentication routes (register and login endpoints)
key_modifications: Added imports for localization utilities: get_language_from_request and translate_message
Modified register() endpoint to accept Request parameter and extract language from Accept-Language header
Modified login() endpoint to accept Request parameter and extract language from Accept-Language header
Replaced 4 hardcoded error messages with localized equivalents: 'email_already_registered', 'invalid_credentials' (used twice), and 'account_inactive'

patterns_discovered.description: HTTP Request object is passed to route handlers to extract Accept-Language header, enabling per-request language determination
Centralized localization functions (get_language_from_request, translate_message) are imported and used consistently across endpoints
All HTTPException detail messages are replaced with translated messages using a key-based approach
Language extraction happens at the beginning of login() but lazily (on-demand) in register(), showing two different timing approaches

gotchas_discovered.description: In login(), language is extracted once at the start; in register(), it's extracted only when needed. This could lead to inconsistent patterns if extended.
gotchas_discovered.recommendation: Standardize to extract language at the beginning of each endpoint for consistency

gotchas_discovered.description: The 'invalid_credentials' message is translated twice in login() (for missing user and for wrong password cases) rather than reusing a single variable
gotchas_discovered.recommendation: Store translated message in a variable and reuse it to reduce redundant function calls

gotchas_discovered.description: The translation keys used (email_already_registered, invalid_credentials, account_inactive) are not documented in this file, making it unclear what localization strings are expected
gotchas_discovered.recommendation: Add comments documenting expected localization keys or reference the localization file

gotchas_discovered.description: The code doesn't show explicit handling for missing or invalid Accept-Language headers
gotchas_discovered.recommendation: Ensure get_language_from_request() has sensible defaults for missing headers

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully implemented localized error messages for authentication routes by integrating localization utilities
approach_outcome.changes_applied: 4 error messages converted from hardcoded English strings to localized messages
functional_improvements: Users can now receive error messages in their preferred language based on Accept-Language header
Centralized error message management through localization utility
Consistent error response format across authentication endpoints
approach_outcome.code_quality: Good - utilizes dependency injection and centralized utilities, though with minor inconsistencies in implementation details

recommendations.recommendation: Standardize language extraction to occur at the start of all endpoints for consistency and potential middleware-based extraction in the future
In login(), store the translated 'invalid_credentials' message in a variable instead of calling translate_message() twice with the same arguments
Add inline comments documenting the expected translation keys and their purposes, or maintain a mapping in the code for reference
Add tests for various Accept-Language header values to ensure proper localization and fallback behavior for unsupported languages
Consider implementing a middleware or dependency injection for automatic language resolution rather than passing Request to each endpoint
